title: Rilke Page Options Schema
description: Creates a new, generic page definition in the given or default project.

path.description: The path at which to create the page file, relative to the current workspace. Default is a folder with the same name as the component in the project root.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the page?

inlineStyle.description: Include styles inline in the page.ts file. Only CSS styles can be included inline. By default, an external styles file is created and referenced in the component.ts file.

inlineTemplate.description: Include template inline in the page.ts file. By default, an external template file is created and referenced in the component.ts file.

viewEncapsulation.description: The view encapsulation strategy to use in the new page.

changeDetection.description: The change detection strategy to use in the new page.

prefix.description: The prefix to apply to the generated page selector.

style.description: The file extension or preprocessor to use for style files, or 'none' to skip generating the style file.

type.description: Adds a developer-defined type to the filename, in the format "name.type.ts".

skipTests.description: Do not create "spec.ts" test files for the new page.

flat.description: Create the new files at the top level of the current project.

skipImport.description: Do not import this page into the owning NgModule.

selector.description: The HTML selector to use for this page.

skipSelector.description: Specifies if the page should have a selector or not.

layer.description: Determine which layer it belongs to.

module.x-prompt: Which feature would you like to use this page?

export.description: The declaring NgModule exports this page.

route.description: The route path for a routes.
